body_html: As far as I know, gcc will also raise warnings for conversion from 'size_t' to 'int' (see here for example). Beyond the warning issue, is there any reason to return an int instead of a size_t since these functions are returning sizes (so positive integer)?
body_text: As far as I know, gcc will also raise warnings for conversion from 'size_t' to 'int' (see here for example). Beyond the warning issue, is there any reason to return an int instead of a size_t since these functions are returning sizes (so positive integer)?
body: As far as I know, gcc will also raise warnings for conversion from 'size_t' to 'int' ([see here for example](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/27490762/how-can-i-convert-to-size-t-from-int-safely)). Beyond the warning issue, is there any reason to return an int instead of a size_t since these functions are returning sizes (so positive integer)?
